title: Python Developer (WFH, Day Shift)
job_desc:
Platinum Outsourcing is an award winning, Australian owned and managed co sourcing BPO – operating out of both the Philippines and Indonesia. We are a fast growing scale-up, opening our first offices in the Philippines only 3 years ago (and growing to 155+ employees in that time).

We have plans to expand to 200+ employees within the next 3 to 6 months.

Our client is an Australian based, SaaS company, with team members in Australia, Vietnam, Philippines and India.

We are seeking an mid level Python Developer , with experience within NoSQL databases.

About you:

  • 3+ years of experience as a Python Developer with a strong portfolio of projects.
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related field
  • Experience with advanced Python programming concepts is essential.
  • Experience writing idiomatic Python code
  • In-depth understanding of the Python software development stacks, ecosystems, frameworks and tools.
  • Experience with Python data processing frameworks such as Pandas
  • Strong knowledge of database technologies, both SQL and NoSQL
  • Experience with writing complex SQL queries and performance tuning
  • Experience with Python project deployments and CI pipelines
  • Excellent problem-solving ability with solid communication and collaboration skills.

What we offer:

 

  • Day shift, no weekends
  • Permanent WFH, or the option for hybrid or WFO
  • Above market remuneration
  • HMO Day 1 - Primary and Dependent 
  • Performance incentives
  • Team building events and activities
  • Brand new IT equipment
  • 15 days VL
  • 5 days sick leave
  • 13 month and all other government mandated benefits

title: Software Developer
job_desc:
About Toolkit Inc.:

At Toolkit Inc., we specialize in transforming business processes through innovative software solutions. Our expertise ranges from ERP implementation with custom Odoo integration to developing full-stack, enterprise-grade applications using the latest technologies. We are at the forefront of incorporating Machine Learning and AI into business analytics, delivering insightful data interpretations. Our team excels in crafting user-centric mobile applications and creative UX designs across various platforms, ensuring an engaging and efficient user experience. Committed to advancing businesses into the digital era, we also offer comprehensive cloud services for seamless, scalable operations. At Toolkit Inc., we are dedicated to making businesses more efficient and effective, one innovative app at a time.

Job Summary:

We are seeking talented and motivated Full-Stack Software Developers to join our team. The successful candidate will work closely with other developers, designers, and project managers to develop and maintain high-quality software applications using a variety of programming languages.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, test, and deploy high-quality software applications using Python, JavaScript, and other programming languages.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate new features and optimize application performance.
  • Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code that adheres to industry standards and best practices.
  • Debug and troubleshoot software issues, and provide solutions to improve application performance and reliability.
  • Develop and maintain documentation, including technical specifications and user manuals, for all software applications.
  • Participate in code review, unit testing, and integration testing to ensure code quality and application functionality.
  • Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in software development, and apply them to develop innovative and efficient solutions.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. Undergraduates with advanced software development skills are also welcome to apply.
  • Strong programming skills in Python, JavaScript, and familiarity with other languages such as Java, C#, Ruby, or PHP.
  • Experience with PostgreSQL and software development tools and technologies such as Git, SQL databases, RESTful APIs, and cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
  • Experience with agile software development methodologies and tools such as Jira, Trello, or Asana.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models using Python libraries such as Pandas, Flask, Django, Tensorflow, Odoo.
  • Familiarity with front-end development technologies such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Understanding of software security principles and best practices.

Why Join Toolkit Inc.?

  • Be part of a creative, forward-thinking team.
  • Opportunity to work on diverse projects and learn new technologies.
  • Competitive salary and benefits package.
  • Flexible working hours and remote working options.
  • A culture that values innovation, efficiency, and continuous learning.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Python Back-end Development)
job_desc:
Recognised as a Great Place to Work, ITRS is an Enterprise SaaS provider with industry-leading solutions. Our prestigious customer base includes 90% of the world's top investment banks. We are backed by leading private equity investors and are rapidly growing.

Our headquarters are in Shoreditch - London's tech hub – with offices in other UK and global locations from the Netherlands to Manila, NYC and Florida. We pride ourselves on a diverse, friendly, dynamic culture - with a focus on internal promotion and developing our people.

 

Scope of role

As a Senior Software Engineer you will deliver new features in our Opsview product suite, you will report to the Engineering Manager in our Makati office. The Engineering team is a global team with main hubs in Manila, Sweden, Spain, UK and North America.

The Makati office is growing and we are looking for Engineers that want to be part of a successful team building software products and working with the latest technologies.  

 

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will:

  • Build software for our Opsview product suite  
  • Take a lead on user story definition and the production of detailed technical designs  
  • Develop software and unit tests against those detailed designs  
  • Take a lead on the production of engineering estimates and timescales
  • Maintain current technical documentation at the code, design and user levels  
  • Maintain the software on an ongoing basis
  • Review others work at design and code stage and provide constructive feedback on how it could be improved  
  • Partner with our dedicated product support team to help fix customer raised defects 



Requirements

  • 5 years of experience with Python Application Development
  • Experience working with RDBMS and NoSQL databases (MySQL and CouchDB)  
  • Experience with Unix/Linux at the command line 
  • Experience in version control systems like Git 
  • Experienced in overseeing product architecture
  • Experience working in continuous integration environments (Jenkins/Groovy) 
  • Experience in code profiling and writing unit tests  
  • Experience improving coding and development practices  
  • Experience quickly assimilating new technologies and skills  
  • Experience working within an Agile scrum team  
  • Willing to work in a hybrid setup, reporting onsite at least once a week to our Makati office



Benefits

  • HMO for you and your dependents
  • Supplemental Medical Claim
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Retirement Plan
  • Flexible Hybrid Working
  • Enhanced Parental Leave
  • Life Assurance
  • Subsidies and Allowances
  • Referral Bonus
  • Buy and Sell Holiday
  • Training Reimbursement

 

 

ITRS Group is an Equal Opportunity employer, and Inclusion is part of our everyday life. We celebrate diversity and pride ourselves on providing an environment where all employees can be their authentic selves and have a voice, allowing everyone to contribute equally. We remain committed to advocating inclusion, diversity, and equality into our ITRS family as we grow and enrich our business.

We welcome applications from everyone in the community as we recognize that a diverse workforce is a stronger workforce.

title: PYTHON DEVELOPER (Hybrid)
job_desc:
JOB OVERVIEW:

We are seeking a highly skilled Python Developer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in developing scalable applications using Python, with a strong understanding of back-end development, data processing, and automation. The Python Developer will collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and maintain efficient and high-performance solutions.

QUALIFICATIONS:

· A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.

· Minimum of 3 years of experience in Python development roles.

· Proficiency in Python frameworks such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI.

· Experience in building RESTful APIs and microservices architecture.

· Strong understanding of database management systems such as PostgreSQL, MySQL/MSSQL, or MongoDB.

· Knowledge of front-end technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus.

· Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.

· Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and version control (Git).

· Strong debugging, problem-solving, and optimization skills.

· Experience working with Agile methodologies and tools like JIRA and Confluence.

title: Senior Backend Developer (Python/Java) Work From Home
job_desc:
Join our award-winning IT team as we lead the way in digital, cloud, and security technology services. You will be playing a critical role in delivering innovative solutions for our biggest client, Canada’s leading telecommunications, tech, and media corporation.

 

We’re looking for passionate and creative tech leaders who want to take their career to the next level and make a real impact. Our success is fueled by our people and our passion for innovation, so we empower our Qmunity and provide a workplace where they can flourish and grow.

 

We offer premium benefits, including:

  • Work From Home Set up
  • Salary based on experience, miscellaneous allowances
  • Performance bonuses and yearly increase
  • HMO from day 1 for you + 2 free dependents
  • 6 months paid maternity/15 days paternity leave
  • Company-sponsored training and upskilling, and career growth opportunities!

 

 You will have the opportunity to…  

  • You will develop design, debug, and operate multiple applications used by Bell network operation/engineering teams and support legacy applications running on-premises.
  • You will provide engineering support on end-to-end problem resolution and root cause analysis in collaboration with other functional groups, business units, and vendors
  • You will represent messaging services with corporate security teams & rest of the company
  • You can quickly learn and adapt to new technologies, and you have a strong aptitude for innovation

                                    

Minimum Required Skills & Experience:

  • 5+ years of experience in Software Development
  • 5+ years of experience in object-oriented software and application development mainly in Python and Java.
  • 5+ years of experience in experience in Agile Development, DevOps, and Test-Driven Design
  • 5+ years of experience in unit testing, Test-Driven Development, code review, continuous integration, continuous delivery & DevOps practices.

 

Nice to have:

  • Someone who is very familiar with code management tools (GIT) and possibly automation/orchestration tools such as Ansible/Puppet but considers Infra-As-Code as a new religion
  • Someone who can slice and dice a business/system problem into an easy modular and maintainable solution with your team
  • A team player who can define, establish, and communicate their long-term vision, who is adaptable to uncertain and changing needs
  • A candidate with strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills (A good sense of humor is a bonus!)
  • Superior coaching skills with the ability to raise your team’s game through your teaching
  • Experience with container environment (Docker, Kubernetes, or even DockerSwarm), because new stuff is fun!
  • Experience with real-time stream processing (Kafka).
  • Experience in a Public Cloud. GCP, AWS, Azure, or any will do.
  • Linux and/or Agile certification
  • Strong IP networking skills     

 

If you’re ready to take the next step in your career, APPLY NOW!

title: Data Engineer I Hybrid
job_desc:
Genpact (NYSE: G) is a global professional services and solutions firm delivering outcomes that shape the future. Our 125,000+ people across 30+ countries are driven by our innate curiosity, entrepreneurial agility, and desire to create lasting value for clients. Powered by our purpose – the relentless pursuit of a world that works better for people – we serve and transform leading enterprises, including the Fortune Global 500, with our deep business and industry knowledge, digital operations services, and expertise in data, technology, and AI.

We are seeking a dynamic and results-oriented individual to join our team as Data Engineer. In this role, you will focus on designing, implementing, and supporting data pipelines using various in-house developed and vendor platforms. In collaboration with business analysts, data producers, and consumers, you will deliver impactful data solutions and streamline business processes.

Responsibilities:

  • Design, implement, and support data pipelines.
  • Collaborate with business analysts, data producers, and consumers to deliver data solutions.
  • Analyze and interpret data to identify patterns and trends.
  • Develop, debug, and test code for data solutions.
  • Work across time zones as part of a globally distributed team to ensure seamless operations.

Qualifications:

  • Experience with database platforms and SQL.
  • Knowledge of designing, building, and maintaining data pipelines.
  • Experience in analyzing and interpreting data to identify patterns and trends.
  • Ability to develop, debug, and test code.
  • Effective communication skills for both business and technical colleagues.
  • Good understanding of data modeling, data structures, and design patterns.
  • Experience with Dataiku preferably or any data engineering tool 
  • Proficiency in Java and/or Python.
  • Familiarity with a data modeling tool 
  • AWS experience and/or certification nice to have

Genpact is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military/veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, physical or mental disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. Genpact is committed to creating a dynamic work environment that values diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, customer focus, and innovation. Get to know us at genpact.com and on LinkedIn, X, YouTube, and Facebook.

title: Python Backend/Fullstack Engineer | Permanent WFH | Night Shift | Day 1 HMO
job_desc:
Code the Future, Engineer Your Success!

Be at the forefront of innovation in the healthcare industry, where every line of code contributes to better patient care and groundbreaking advancements. This global role lets you make a meaningful impact while staying rooted at home. Drive change, tackle exciting challenges, and take your career to the next level in healthcare technology.

Job Description

As a Python Backend/Fullstack Engineer, you will design, develop, and maintain innovative web applications using Python. You'll collaborate with diverse teams to deliver scalable, high-performance solutions, optimize code, and contribute to the planning and successful execution of impactful software projects.

Job Overview

Employment Type: Full-Time
Shift: Night Shift; Mon - Fri, 09:00 PM to 06:00 AM, Weekends Off
Work Setup: Permanent Work From Home

Exciting Perks Await!

  • Day 1 HMO coverage with free dependent
  • Competitive Salary Package
  • Permanent WFH arrangement
  • Fixed weekends off
  • Unlimited upskilling through Emapta Academy courses (Want to know more? Visit https://bit.ly/EmaptaTrainingCalendar)
  • Free 24/7 access to our office gyms (Ortigas and Makati) with a free physical fitness trainer!
  • Exclusive Emapta Lifestyle perks (hotel and restaurant discounts, and more!)
  • Unlimited opportunities for employee referral incentives across the organization
  • Standard government and Emapta benefits
  • Total of 20 annual leaves to be used on your own discretion (including 5 credits convertible to cash)
  • Fun engagement activities for employees
  • Mentorship and exposure to global leaders and teams
  • Career growth opportunities
  • Diverse and supportive work environment

The Qualifications We Seek

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • 4+ years of hands-on Python development experience in web or software applications (strictly required).
  • Proficiency in backend development with strong knowledge of web application architecture and RESTful API design.
  • Experience with database management, including MySQL, PostgreSQL, or MongoDB.
  • Familiarity with version control systems, particularly Git.
  • Optional: Experience with front-end technologies, especially React (nice-to-have).
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues.
  • Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively in a team environment.
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Willing to work night shifts as required.

Your Daily Tasks

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and analyze project requirements.
  • Design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable web applications using Python and React.
  • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code while adhering to best practices and coding standards.
  • Implement responsive and user-friendly interfaces to enhance the overall user experience.
  • Integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic in collaboration with backend developers.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and optimize code to improve performance and reliability.
  • Stay updated on industry trends and advancements to continuously refine development processes.
  • Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to enhance team performance.
  • Collaborate with product managers and stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of features and projects.
  • Plan and execute software development projects, ensuring adherence to timelines and milestones.

About the Client: Driving Innovation in the Healthcare Industry

Our client is a leader in the healthcare industry, committed to advancing solutions that transform patient care and outcomes. With a focus on innovation and collaboration, they deliver cutting-edge technology to improve healthcare processes. Be part of a team that values your expertise while working on projects that make a difference globally.

Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and discover the #EmaptaExperience!

title: Python Developer for LLM Data Annotation/Generation
job_desc:
Position Summary


Role: Software Developer - Data Annotation / Generation Engineer


Nature of Project: LLM for Code Generation (Coding Projects Focus)


We are looking for experienced software developers to join our team and contribute to the advancement of artificial intelligence through the generation and curation of datasets to be used for coding generation. Successful candidates will be involved in creating, preparing, and assessing code-related datasets that our clients will use for their AI model training, ensuring that future AI coding assistants are accurate, efficient, and proficient in generating high-quality software development code.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Tasks may vary between projects. Example tasks may include:
  • Generation of coding-related dialogue between humans and AI assistants
  • Test case creation for human and AI-generated code
  • Completion and repair of broken code
  • Evaluation of an AI model’s proposed solution for coding tasks based on a coding instruction prompt
  • Assessment of coding instruction prompts to ensure clarity and feasibility
  • Review and validation of the modifications made to a source code by an AI model to a coding instruction prompt
  • Detailed feedback on the and the corresponding response across multiple parameters, as defined by the client


Qualifications:


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience in software development
  • 2 to 4 years of actual development experience in at least one of the following programming languages- Python, Java, JavaScript- with a strong understanding of data structures and language fundamentals
  • Technical lead experience in handling development teams
  • Performs code and design review ensuring best practices are observed by the development team
  • Experience with test-driven development
  • Experience with code optimization
  • Excellent command of the English language, with strong reading comprehension, and writing skills
  • Strong problem-solving and troubleshooting abilities
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet tight deadlines
  • Outcome-driven focus with excellent time management and decision-making skills


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in command-line development and deployment.
  • Experience in both front-end and back-end development is a plus
  • Experience with cloud services and modern development platforms
  • Experience in data annotation and labeling


Looking for candidates with experience in any of the following areas:


Python

  • Web development and deployment - Django, Flask
  • Data processing libraries - Pyspark, NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Matplotlib
  • AI/ML libraries - TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, Keras, OpenCV


JavaScript

  • TypeScript
  • Angular
  • ReactJS


Java

  • Spring Boot
  • Java 8 to Java 11 SE;
  • build and deployment to application servers
  • JUnit and Mock Testing

title: Software Support Developer | WFH | Flexi Shift | Weekends Off | Day 1 HMO
job_desc:
Break Bugs, Not Boundaries—Support Software that Shapes Business Growth.

When it comes to digital strategy and delivery, AbroadSource is the go-to expert for companies ready to scale. Since 2015, they’ve built a reputation for excellence in web development, software applications, and marketing automation. Their unique approach blends research-backed strategy with highly specialized outsourced teams. They invest in talent that builds transformation. At AbroadSource, your tech support skills go further—solving problems, streamlining systems, and making global impact without leaving the country.

As a Software Support Developer, you’ll handle second-level technical issues, perform in-depth troubleshooting using development tools, and implement solutions in PHP or Angular. You’ll document fixes, collaborate with internal teams, and help streamline support processes—reducing response times while enhancing the quality of client issue resolution and overall service delivery.

Employment type: Full-Time

Shift: Monday to Friday (Flexi), Weekends Off

Work setup: Permanent Work From Home

Exciting Perks Await!

  • Day 1 HMO coverage with free dependent

  • Fully customized Emapta laptop with peripherals 

  • Permanent WFH arrangement

  • Flexible work schedule

  • Fixed weekends off

title: Data Analyst - Python
job_desc:
Job Brief:

We are looking for a Data Analyst who can employ data analysis, machine learning, and programming expertise to enhance the performance of AEON and its affiliates. Your role will be instrumental in constructing data products to uncover valuable business insights.

Your role will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams, developing predictive models, and presenting actionable recommendations. Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills are imperative for interpreting large and complex data sets. Your primary goal will be to assist AEON affiliates in making well-informed decisions by scrutinizing trends and patterns.

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • The Data Analyst is responsible for providing strategic, analytical, and technical support in all business intelligence activities for AEON.
  • The Data Analyst will work closely with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to identify business opportunities and provide data-driven solutions.
  • Create proposals and conduct end-to-end project management including scoping, building, testing, implementation, maintenance, and tracking and optimization.
  • Identify relevant data sources and mine necessary information for business needs.
  • Extract, transform, and analyze data from various sources to generate actionable insights.
  • Prepare data analysis and reports to monitor performance and identify quality controls necessary for improvement and development of AEON's products.
  • Prepare presentations and communicate complex findings and insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear manner.
  • Develop and implement algorithms and models in R, Python, or other tools for predictive and prescriptive analytics.
  • Collaborate with software engineers to deploy models into production using API and monitor their performance.
  • Conduct ad-hoc analyses to answer specific business questions.

 

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or an equivalent related field.
  • Minimum of 2-5 years working in the data science field with proven experience in model development and/or deployment.
  • Excellent programming skills in R or Python (Proficiency in Python; knowledge in Scikit-learn, pandas, seaborn, and similar tools is preferred).
  • Excellent SQL skills (Familiarity with PostgreSQL, Oracle is preferred).
  • Experience in Flask, FastAPI, and similar technologies.
  • Experience in data visualization using Tableau is a plus.
  • Experience in AWS (Sagemaker & S3) is a plus.
  • Excellent presentation skills, both in oral and written communication.
  • High attention to detail and strong documentation skills.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer | Permanent WFH | Day Shift | Weekends Off
job_desc:
Code Healthier Futures with Every Line

Use your full stack development skills to transform the future of healthcare technology. Build high-performance systems that support real-world health outcomes and leave a lasting global impact—right from home.

Here’s your chance to join a forward-thinking healthcare tech team without compromising work-life balance. With a fixed day shift and weekends off, you’ll enjoy the freedom to pursue a global career in tech while still having time for the things that matter most.

Job Description

As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you’ll write, optimize, and debug software in multiple languages, build scalable systems, manage databases, support integration and security, and collaborate with stakeholders to create innovative healthcare solutions.

Job Overview

Employment type: Full-time

Shift: Day Shift, Monday to Friday, 08:00 AM – 05:00 PM (Weekends off)

Work setup: Permanent Work-from-Home

Exciting Perks Await!

  • Fun engagement activities for employees

  • Career growth opportunities

  • Diverse and supportive work environment

The Qualifications We Seek

  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in full stack development

  • Proficient in C#, .NET Framework, ASP.NET, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and related frameworks

  • Strong understanding of object-oriented programming and design patterns

  • Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and CLR

  • Familiar with TFS, automated testing, and continuous integration practices

  • Business intelligence experience is desirable

  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills

  • Willing to work on a night shift, if required

  • Must meet performance metrics and current job expectations

Your Daily Tasks

  • Develop programs using various languages including C++, C#, .NET, PHP, Java, JavaScript, SQL, Python, and other company-used technologies

  • Update and enhance existing applications to improve functionality and performance

  • Debug and test programs to identify and fix errors

  • Utilize computer-assisted software engineering (CASE) tools to automate code generation

  • Leverage code libraries to streamline development and ensure efficiency

  • Execute database queries and manage programmability tasks

  • Provide software support and troubleshooting assistance

  • Prepare system documentation and user manuals

  • Submit monthly reports to the IT Manager

  • Generate ad-hoc reports based on stakeholder requests

  • Implement and manage software security measures

  • Develop using C# and .NET Framework with strong understanding of their ecosystems

  • Work at a senior level with ASP.NET, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks such as Angular, Node.js, and JQuery

  • Apply object-oriented programming principles effectively

  • Create reusable libraries and APIs to enhance modular development

  • Utilize various design and architectural patterns

  • Work with Microsoft SQL Server for database management

  • Write clean, readable, and maintainable code

  • Apply design principles to build scalable applications

  • Create database schemas that support business processes

  • Understand Common Language Runtime (CLR), including its limitations and workarounds

  • Implement automated testing platforms and conduct unit testing

  • Use code versioning tools, especially TFS

  • Apply continuous integration practices

  • Contribute to projects involving business intelligence, where applicable

About the Client

Rest Assured, Innovation Never Sleeps

Our client, SomnoMed, is a global leader in oral appliance therapy for the treatment of obstructive sleep apnea. With a commitment to innovation and patient-centric solutions, they support better sleep and better lives through technology-enabled healthcare. They are now expanding their development team to scale their digital solutions.

Welcome to Emapta Philippines!

Join a team that values camaraderie, excellence, and growth. Recognized as one of the Top 20 Dream Companies of Filipinos in 2024, Emapta stands proudly alongside industry giants, offering stability and exciting career opportunities. Your career flourishes here with competitive compensation, international clients, and a work culture focused on collaboration and innovation. Work with global clients across industries, supported by a stable foundation and like-minded professionals passionate about making an impact. We empower your success with opportunities for personal and professional development in an inclusive environment. Apply now and be part of the #EmaptaEra!

title: Senior Fullstack Developer (Python/Odoo)
job_desc:
Be a part of our fast-growing team and unchain all the possibilities!

 

What is your mission?

We are looking for a Senior Fullstack Developer for Odoo and Python. In this role, you will be responsible for the development, customization, and maintenance of Odoo modules, as well as the integration of AI-driven solutions to enhance business processes. You will work closely with the IT Director and collaborate with various teams to implement solutions that align with our company’s objectives and technological goals.

  • Document technical designs, processes, and changes in code.
  • Provide continuous support for system improvements, including AI-driven features.
  • Contribute to system analysis and design, utilizing AI insights.

Who are we looking for?

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • At least 5 years of experience in Python or Odoo development and implementation.
  • Proven expertise in AI technologies such as machine learning, natural language processing, or predictive analytics.
  • Strong proficiency in Python and the Odoo framework.
  • Familiarity with PostgreSQL, XML, JavaScript, and other Odoo technologies.
  • Solid experience in the full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC).
  • Knowledge of AI tools and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or OpenAI.
  • Exceptional problem-solving abilities and analytical thinking.
  • Must be available for full-time, onsite work in Ortigas, Pasig City.
  • Strong communication skills for effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and clients.
  • A collaborative mindset and a passion for teamwork.
  • Experience with Agile methodologies is a plus.

 

Company Perks

  • Dynamic company events
  • Opportunities for promotion
  • Free meals and snacks

title: Big Data Engineer
company: FIRSTMAC OPERATIONS CENTER PTY LTD-PHILIPPINE BRANCH
job_desc:
POSITION PURPOSE: The big data team is responsible for developing, monitoring and maintaining the data warehouse and the integration of business development tools to enable a more strategic, tactical and operational business. Big data technologies include AWS hosted databases and components such as Postgres and Redshift DB’s, AWS Data Pipelines, Lambda functions and Python code to deliver scalable solutions to the business.

 

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Designing and implementing the architecture of ETL using PySpark and SQL language in AWS Glue.
  • Designing and developing transactional and analytical data structures.
  • Aligning the Data technical capabilities to business objectives.
  • Developing reporting solutions to support Business Intelligence, including resolving problems related to data analysis and reporting services.
  • Establishing and maintaining policies, operational procedures, and associated documentation for user interaction with the database environment.
  • Following Firstmac standards and best practice for the deployment of AWS components and code using source code controls such as BitBucket, and utilizing DevOps tools (e.g., Terraform), apps, and CLI as appropriate.
  • Recommending improvements to existing approaches and practices within Data Governance forums and other appropriate meetings.

 

TECHNICAL SKILLS:

  • Python 3+ including Virtual environments, PIP, Pypy, Package development, Boto3, sqlalchemy, Pytest
  • ETL / ELT experience with SQL & Python within a big data environment.
  • Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
  • Excellent coding skills, source control management (ie git) across programming languages with a strong focus on unit and integration testing
  • SQL (ANSI, TSQL, PL/pgSQL)
  • Experience in deploying AWS components remotely using AWS CLI Ability to perform database modelling and design, develop, debug, troubleshoot database objects, stored procedures and functions
  • Knowledgeable on LINUX with the ability to program shell scripts
  • Experience in developing and maintaining software solutions within the AWS ecosystem (S3, Redshift, DynamoDB).

 

JOB QUALIFICATIONS:

  • With at least 3-5 years of work experience and familiarity with the entire software development life cycle and facilitating agile practices and methodology
  • Graduate of Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or related fields

 

KEY COMPETENCIES:

  •  Reporting and Analysis: Understanding of constructing, designing, and reporting using Power BI and a dimensional data warehouse.
  • Communication: Proficient in communicating insights from Reports and Analysis to the business.
  • Numeric and Data Analytics Skills: Prior experience implementing and utilizing analytics with BI tools such as Power BI, Python, and MongoDB data.
  • Database Skills: Experience in working with databases and analysing insights preferably with Athena, Redshift, MongoDB.

 

IMPORTANT NOTE:

  • 100mbps minimum internet speed.
  • An ideal work space set-up for optimized work productivity is a given.
  • Company asset (laptop) will provided upon hiring.

 

Interested parties may apply direct to Jobstreet. Interviews to be done online remotely by video call with Human Resources.

title: Software Engineer
job_desc:

  • Participates in requirements gathering, IT & software solution analysis, design, development, implementation and validation of new IT & software systems.
  • Involves in customizations, modifications and redevelopments of application to ensure essential local business operations and supports
  • Involves in maintenance and performance enhancement of existing IT & software tools systems, correcting system bug and redeploy the program if it is needed.
  • Providing IT & software support for all company internal users to ensure the sustainability of IT & software systems.

What we're looking for

  • Minimum 2 years of experience in software development, with a strong understanding of software engineering principles and best practices
  • Proficiency in one or more programming languages
  • Familiarity with software development frameworks, databases, and cloud technologies

At Manpower Outsourcing Services, Inc.', we value our employees and strive to provide a nurturing and rewarding work environment. As a Software Engineer, you can expect:

  • Competitive salary and benefits package

Join our team and be a part of our exciting journey as we continue to push the boundaries of what's possible in the ICT industry.

Apply now to become our next Software Engineer!

title: Full Stack Software Engineer - 100% Remote (Typescript | Next.js | NestJS)
job_desc:
Acquire BPO is an award-winning business process outsource provider, to some of the world’s largest brands operating contact centers and back-office services from offshore, nearshore, and onshore locations to clients globally and serviced from Australia, Dominican Republic, Philippines and the United States. Known for our commitment to safety, flexibility, and innovation, we strive to be the partner of choice for businesses looking to leverage the best global BPO and AI resources. Our employee value proposition, Come for a career, stay for the fun, underscores our commitment to a vibrant, inclusive, and engaging work environment.

 

Why Join the A-Team?

Come for a career, stay for the fun!

  • Growth! Grow with us and utilise our learning and development opportunities and annual training budget.
  • Health Care: Enjoy a healthcare allowance for your well-being.
  • Flexi-Time: Take advantage of flexible working hours to improve work-life balance.
  • Brand new laptop!
  • Competitive monthly salary.
  • Vibes: Join a fun, collaborative, growing team …and more!

 

A Glimpse into Your New Role

Your tasks for the day include, but are not limited to, the following: 

  • This is a fully remote role and you’ll be joining a growing team in the Philippines and working with a supportive engineering team based in New Zealand.
  • In our technology stack we believe in using the best tool for the job, along with stable, smooth and regular releases where we build the best experiences for our customers.
  • Work with modern technologies - our tech stack is built on GCP, using NextJS, React and Typescript on the frontend with NestJS and Typescript on the backend.
  • Work in an agile delivery team, collaborating with developers, testers and product owners.
  • Participate in knowledge sharing sessions and demos with the engineering team and wider business.
  • Work in a continual learning environment that fosters and encourages innovation, creativity and collaboration.
  • Open communication, strong spoken and written english to communicate your ideas and ask questions.

 

What You’ll Bring

Consistent to our goal as an organization, at Acquire BPO, we are looking for individuals who are passionate in winning; those who enjoy achieving goals with the determination to go beyond hurdles. As a Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be able to:

  • Think strategically: See the big picture, plan ahead, and put thought into action
  • Be adaptable: Demonstrate a willingness to be flexible, versatile and tolerant in a changing work environment while maintaining effectiveness and efficiency
  • Foster Teamwork: Work cooperatively with others to set goals, resolve problems, and make decisions that enhance company effectiveness
  • Problem Solve: Assess problem situations to identify causes. Gather and process relevant information, generate possible solutions, and make recommendations to resolve the problem.
  • Build Relationships: Establish and maintain positive working relationships with others, both internally and externally, to achieve the goals of the company.
  • Learn: Growth is important to us and sometimes that means making mistakes and asking for help when needed

With a diverse global team working together, we proudly embrace and live by these shared values: 

  • Collaboration: Brilliant jerks can be brilliant elsewhere. 
  • Impact: Do, get it done, create impact. 
  • Passion: Be positive, bring passion and energy. 
  • Transparency: A transparent team can help each other. 

 

What are you waiting for? 

Join the A-Team and experience the A-Life!

title: Software Engineer / Programmer  - remote work
job_desc:
We are seeking a professional, innovative, and knowledgeable Software Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this fully remote role, you will play a critical part in designing, developing, and integrating software solutions that drive our internal systems and services. This position requires a self-motivated engineer with expertise in both front-end and back-end technologies, as well as modern automation platforms.

Technical Requirements:

  • Proficient in PHP, Java, and JavaScript frameworks (e.g., Node.js, React, Angular).

  • Strong understanding and practical use of JSON, RESTful APIs, and OAuth 2.0 authentication flows.

  • Experience with Power Automate, Power Apps, and the Microsoft 365 Ecosystem (including SharePoint Online, Teams, Outlook, Graph API).

  • Comfortable working with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL) and designing efficient schemas and queries.

  • Solid grasp of API integration concepts, including third-party system connectivity and data synchronization.

  • Familiarity with DevOps pipelines, CI/CD workflows, version control using Git, and containerization (e.g., Docker).

  • Awareness of current best practices in software security, performance optimization, and scalable architecture.

General Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent technical discipline.

  • A minimum of 3 years of hands-on software engineering or full stack development experience.

  • Strong English communication skills, both verbal and written.

  • Ability to work independently while collaborating in a remote team setting.

  • Typing speed of 50 words per minute or higher.

  • A proactive mindset, critical thinking skills, and ability to solve problems efficiently.

  • A reliable and high-speed internet connection.

  • Operating system: Windows 10 or 11 (Mac OS may be used where compatible, but Windows required for certain dev tools).

  • Minimum 1920x1080 resolution monitor.

  • Quiet, professional home office environment suitable for remote development.

Responsibilities Include:

  • Developing, testing, and deploying scalable web and desktop applications across internal and external systems.

  • Designing and maintaining secure and efficient APIs for system interoperability.

  • Automating workflows using Power Automate, connecting SharePoint, Teams, Outlook, and third-party services.

  • Writing clear, maintainable, and well-documented code across multiple programming languages.

  • Troubleshooting and debugging production issues and proactively improving application performance.

  • Participating in code reviews and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality products.

  • Creating integration logic between on-premises SQL servers and Microsoft cloud services using custom APIs or hybrid connectors.

  • Contributing to UI/UX improvements and optimizing user interactions across platforms.

  • Staying up to date with emerging technologies and recommending improvements to existing systems.

Bonus Skills (Preferred, Not Required):

  • Experience with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, and Microsoft Graph API.

  • Experience in Agile/Scrum development environments.

  • Familiarity with AI/ML integration, chatbot frameworks, or Copilot SDK.

  • Experience working with WordPress, PowerShell, or .NET platforms.

  • Knowledge of HIPAA compliance, data privacy, and secure healthcare application development (a plus for healthcare-based environments).

Benefits:

  • 100% remote work with flexible hours.

  • Collaborative, forward-thinking, and inclusive engineering team.

  • Low-stress, high-autonomy environment.

  • Opportunities for professional growth, training, and certifications.

  • Be part of meaningful projects that support innovation and digital transformation in healthcare and business operations.

  • We are an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.

title: IT Programmer
job_desc:
Duties and Responsibilities:

•       Develop detailed design for modules that need to be developed and align with the requirements and architecture

•       Develops application code and configuration/scripts according to the agreed functional design, technical design, methodologies and standards for package deployment

•       Develops system & operational documentation and user guides

•       Prepares package, configuration files, deployment scripts and installation guide for all environments

•       Support production when necessary

Qualifications:

•       Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or any courses relevant for the role

•       0 to 3 years of experience in IT development

•       Very conversant programming languages like C#, ASP.NET MVC/WEBFORMS, VB.NET, HTML, Java, Javascript, Python, Ruby, PHP, MS-SQL, Oracle DB, JQUERY, RDLC reporting, Crystal Reports, IOS, Android.  On the frontend, expertise in either the iOS and/or Android is a must.

•       Hands on experience on 1-2 core Platforms like CRM, Mobile app development, ECM, Data etc with at least 2 end to end projects delivered.

•       Conversant with programming/development tools like Development platforms/IDE, Configuration management, Code review etc.

•       Worked with Agile and Waterfall delivery methods

title: Software Developer
job_desc:
• At least 2 years experience in Web and System Development
  • Able to work structured and independent
  • Knowledgeable in Java, MySQL, JSON, PHP and PHP Framework
